sub_topic: Finding the angle between two vectors using trigonometry
message_1: A plane is flying at a speed of 500 km/h at a bearing of 30 degrees from a control tower. Another plane is flying at a speed of 400 km/h at a bearing of 120 degrees from the same tower. Find the angle between the two planes.
message_2:
To find the angle between the two planes, we need to find the difference between their bearings.

The bearing of the first plane is 30 degrees, and the bearing of the second plane is 120 degrees.

The angle between the two planes is the absolute difference between their bearings:

Angle = |120 - 30|

Angle = |90|

Angle = 90 degrees

So, the angle between the two planes is 90 degrees.
